str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hasten, be eager, be zealous. From spoude; to use speed, i.e. To make effort, be prompt or earnest.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A calling, invitation; in the NT, always of a divine call. From a shorter form of kaleo; an invitation.
A choosing out, selecting, choice (by God). From eklegomai; selection.
Firm, steadfast, enduring, sure, certain. From the base of basis; stable.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To stumble, fall, sin, err, transgress. A form of pipto; to trip, i.e. to err, sin, fail.
